alert.note: Alert for Erie (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 21 at 10:36PM EDT until May 22 at 12:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM EDT SUNDAY FOR SOUTHEASTERN ERIE COUNTY... At 1036 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 3 and 4.5 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Corry, Union City and Elgin. 4 homes have been evacuated in Union City with water up to the roof tops. Numerous basements are also flooded. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
